tn.text: Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: You are the people ... you are a nation ... has chosen you
tn.text: All occurrences of "you" refer to the people of Israel. Moses was included as a part of the people. AT: "We are the people ... we are a nation ... has chosen us"

tn.ref: Do not cut yourselves, nor shave any part of your face for the dead
tn.text: These were ways the people groups living in Canaan showed that they were grieving over people who had died. Moses is telling the people of Israel not to act like them. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: nor shave any part of your face
tn.text: "nor shave the front of your head"

tn.ref: For you are a nation ... surface of the earth
tn.text: Translate these words as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:07:06|7:6]].

tn.ref: you are a nation that is set apart to Yahweh your God
tn.text: Yahweh choosing the people of Israel to belong to him in a special way is spoken of as if Yahweh set them apart from all other nations. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh your God has set you apart from other nations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Yahweh has chosen you to be a people for his own possession
tn.text: This means basically the same thing as the first part of the sentence. They both mean that the people of Israel belong to Yahweh in a special way. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: a people for his own possession
tn.text: "a people for his treasured possession" or "his people"

tn.ref: more than all peoples that are on the surface of the earth
tn.text: "out of all the people groups in the world"

tn.ref: You must not eat any abominable thing
tn.text: The people of Israel were not supposed to eat anything that God said was unfit for eating.

tn.ref: the deer, the gazelle, the roebuck
tn.text: These are all types of deer. If your language does not have a word for each animal it can be translated as "all kinds of deer."
This is wild animal with long thin legs that can run quickly. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:12:15|12:15]].
a type of deer (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
Both of these are types of antelope. If your language does not have a word for each animal it can be translated as "all kinds of antelope."
a type of antelope (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
"that have split hooves" (UDB). This is a hoof that is split into two parts instead of being one whole.
This means the animal brings its food up from its stomach and chews it again.
This is a small animal with long ears that usually lives in holes in the ground. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
This is a small animal that lives in rocky places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
Something Yahweh says is unfit for his people to eat is spoken of as if it were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: The pig is unclean for you
tn.text: Something Yahweh says is unfit for his people to eat is spoken of as if it were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: Of these things that are in water you may eat
tn.text: "You may eat these kinds of animals that live in the water"
the thin, flat part which the fish uses to move through the water
the small plates that cover the body of the fish
Something Yahweh says is unfit for his people to eat is spoken of as if it were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
An animal that God says is fit for his people to eat is spoken of as if the animal were physically clean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: eagle ... vulture ... osprey ... red kite ... black kite ... falcon
tn.text: These are birds that are either awake at night or feed on small animals and dead animals. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
These are all types of birds that are either awake at night or feed on small animals and dead animals. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
These are types of birds that eat small animals and lizards. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
animal with wings and furry body which is awake mainly at night and eats insects and rodents
This means all flying insects that move in large groups.
Animals that God says are unfit for his people to eat are spoken of as if the animals are physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must not eat them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Animals that God says are fit for his people to eat are spoken of as if the animals are physically clean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.
This means an animal that dies a natural death.

tn.ref: For you are a nation that is set apart to Yahweh your God
tn.text: Yahweh choosing the people of Israel to belong to him in a special way is spoken of as if Yahweh set them apart from all other nations. This can be stated in active form. AT: "For Yahweh your God has set you apart from other nations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: tithe all the yield of your seed
tn.text: This means they are to give one part out of every ten equal parts from their crops.
"every year"
"in the presence of Yahweh"
Here "it" refers to the tithe of crops and livestock.

tn.ref: you will convert the offering into money
tn.text: "you will sell your offering for money"

tn.ref: tie up the money in your hand, and go
tn.text: "put the money in a bag and take it with you"
"for whatever you want"
"in the presence of Yahweh"

tn.ref: The Levite who is within your gates
tn.text: Here "gate" represents the entire city or town. AT: "Any Levite who lives in your towns" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This can be stated in positive form. AT: "make sure to give some of your tithe to the Levite" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])

tn.ref: for he has no portion nor inheritance with you
tn.text: The tribe of Levi did not receive a portion of land as their inheritance. Their share of the inheritance was the honor of serving Yahweh as his priests. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: no portion nor inheritance with you
tn.text: God not giving land to the Levites is spoken of as if he were not giving them an inheritance. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: every three years you will present all the tithe of your produce
tn.text: Once every 3 years the Israelites were to store their tithes within their own towns so that it would be used to provide for the Levites, orphans, widows and foreigners. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Here "gates" represents the entire city or town. AT: "inside your city"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: because he has no portion nor inheritance with you
tn.text: God not giving any land to the Levites is spoken of as if he were not giving them an inheritance. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
These are children whose parents have both died and do not have relatives to care for them.
This is a woman whose husband has died and has no children to care for her in her old age.

tn.ref: in all the work of your hand that you do
tn.text: Here "hand" represents the whole person. This refers to the work that someone does. AT: "in all the work you do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
